icontrol.drivers.instruments.agilent

Class Agilent4155

  • java.lang.Object
    • icontrol.drivers.Device
      • icontrol.drivers.instruments.agilent.Agilent4155

  • @iC_Annotation(CommPorts=GPIB,
               InstrumentClassName="Agilent 4155")
public class Agilent4155
extends Device
    This class implements functionality to communicate with an Agilent 4155 Semiconductor Parameter Analyzer. It was tested with a 4155C but should also work with 4155A/B/C and a 4156B/C. It uses the SCPI commands and ASCII transfer.

    Instrument Commands:

    • AutoCalibration(boolean)
    • ButtonSingle()
    • ButtonStop()
    • DisplayUpdate(boolean)
    • Measure(String, String, String, String)
    • PlotData(String, boolean, String, boolean, String, boolean, String)
    • SaveData(String, String, boolean)
    • DisplayAxis(String, String, String, float, float)
    • configMeasurementMode(String)
    • configSMU(int, String, String, String, String)
    • configSMUConstant(int, float, float)
    • configSweep(String, boolean, String, float, float, float, float, float, float)
    • configVMU(int, String, String)
    • Note that more commands are defined as generic GPIB commands

    Some peculiarities of this Instrument-Class:

    • Because measurements can take a few 10's of seconds, and because the 4155 performs automatic calibrations from time to time, it was necessary to implement methods that check the status of the 4155 and if it is ready to receive commands. This functionality has been implemented in the methods WaitAndSendToInstrument and WaitAndQueryInstrument, respectively, in WaitUntilReady and isReady. It is advisable to use these wrapper methods to communicate with the 4155.
    • Because there is the need to wait until the 4155 becomes ready to receive commands, is is possible to define a default time-out for these methods. The default time-out value can be set in iC.properties, which is also accessible without having to recompile the iC program.
    • The maximum number of points that can be measured in sweep mode is 1001, and the GPIB buffer size to read the response has been set to 150000 to accommodate such responses from the 4155. If for some reason the 4155's response becomes longer, an error is generated, and the GPIB buffer size needs to be increased (or implement a method that reads twice from GPIB without sending a command first).
    • The 4155 is a delicate Instrument to handle, which is why a checkErrorQueue method is implemented. It is recommended to use it wisely, and better once to often than once to few.

    Version:
    0.4
    Author:
    KPP (Kurt Pernstich: pernstich@alumni.ethz.ch)

      • Open

        public void Open()
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 javax.script.ScriptException
        Extra initialization of the Agilent 4155 after establishing the IO Connection via GPIB. It invokes the base class' Open, and sets the data format to ascii.

        The description of the parameters and exceptions was copied from the implementation in the super class. See Device.OpenGPIB(int) for details.

        Overrides:
        Open in class Device
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when an sending / receiving data caused a GPIB error
        javax.script.ScriptException - when the response to a *IDN? query does not match the expected result; bubbles up from checkIDN.

      • WaitAndSendToInstrument

        void WaitAndSendToInstrument(java.lang.String Message)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits until the 4155 is ready to receive a command, and then sends the command. A maximum wait time can be specified, and in the moment it is set to infinity, so this method returns only when the 4155 is ready to receive a command. The maximum wait time is specified in the iC.properties resource.
        Parameters:
        Message - this String is sent to the Instrument
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from WaitUntilReady or when the 4155 did not become ready within the maximum wait time.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - when the user pressed the stop button (the m_StopScripting flag is set to true) while the 4155 was not ready to receive a command (bubbles up from WaitUntilReady).
        See Also:
        WaitUntilReady(int)

      • WaitAndQueryInstrument

        java.lang.String WaitAndQueryInstrument(java.lang.String Message)
                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                        java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits until the 4155 is ready to receive a command, and then queries the command. The maximum time this method waits for the 4155 to become ready is specified in the iC.properties resource.
        Parameters:
        Message - this String is sent to the Instrument
        Returns:
        The response of the Instrument
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from WaitUntilReady or when the 4155 did not become ready within a certain time, typically 50 sec.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - when the user pressed the stop button (the m_StopScripting flag is set to true) while the 4155 was not ready to receive a command (bubbles up from WaitUntilReady).

      • isReady

        @Deprecated
private boolean isReady()
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. Use WaitUntilReady instead
        Checks the status of the 4155 and returns true if the Instrument is ready to receive a command (= the measurement is done).

        The GPIB answer of the 4155 comes typically instantaneous, but can also be delayed if the 4155 is pulsing, updating the display (which may take some seconds), or calibrating (which takes 45 sec), at least in some older 4155B's. Any read function, can therefore cause a GPIB Time-Out. This method tries to get an answer if the Instrument is ready to receive a command by reading the Operation Status Register (p. 3-10).

        Returns:
        true if the measurement is done and the 4155 is ready to receive a GPIB command
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from QueryInstrument or setTimeout

      • checkErrorQueue

        private void checkErrorQueue(java.lang.String Message)
                      throws javax.script.ScriptException
        Queries the head of the 4155's Error Queue. The error is removed from the error queue. This method simply returns when no error was found in the queue or throws a ScriptException with the Error Number and Message if an error occurred. It also returns if in NoCommunicationMode.
        Parameters:
        Message - This String is appended to the Error Message in case an error occurred.
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - if 1) the error queue could not be queried (when an IOException occurred in WaitAndQueryInstrument, or 2) the returned error number from the 4155 could not be converted into an Integer (should never happen unless GPIB transmission introduces an error), or 3) an error was found in the error queue.

      • WaitUntilReady

        private boolean WaitUntilReady(int MaxWaitTime)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits until the 4155 is ready to receive a GPIB command (= the measurement is done, the 4155 is not calibrating, or the 4155 is not otherwise busy with some task) or the maximum wait time has been reached. The method also exits and returns false if scripting has been stopped. This method is also interrupted when scripting is paused.

        The GPIB answer of the 4155 comes typically instantaneous, but can also be delayed if the 4155 is pulsing, updating the display (which may take some seconds), or calibrating (which takes 45 sec). Any read function, can therefore cause a GPIB Time-Out. This method sets the Time-Out of the GPIB bus to 0.5 sec, tries to get an answer if the Instrument is ready to receive a command by reading the Operation Status Register (p. 3-10). Once the 4155 is ready or the maximum wait time has been reached, the previous GPIB Time-Out is restored.

        Parameters:
        MaxWaitTime - Maximum wait time in seconds. If MaxWaitTime is 0 then this method waits infinitely long for the 4155 to become ready.
        Returns:
        true if the measurement is done and the 4155 is ready to receive a GPIB command. Also returns true if in No-Communication-Mode. Returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from QueryInstrument or setTimeout
        java.lang.InterruptedException - when the user pressed the stop button (the m_StopScripting flag is set to true) while the 4155 was not ready to receive a command.
        See Also:
        icontrol.drivers.Device#inNoCommunicationMode() }

        Performs a Syntax-Check for the correct Name. A correct name can contain 6 alphanumeric letters and must start with an alphabet character.

        Throws:

      • LoadMeasurementSetup

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Load a measurement setup from internal memory or from the disk drive.",
                   ParameterNames="File Name",
                   ToolTips="Choose \'1\'-\'4\' to load from internal memory or \'xxx.MES\', \'xxx.STR\', or \'xxx.CST\' to load from the disk drive")
private void LoadMeasurementSetup(java.lang.String FileName)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a measurement setup from the 4155'es internal memory or from the disk drive. This method returns if it is interrupted by the user before the 4155 becomes ready to receive a command.

        Remark: Make this method public if you like to access it from a script.

        Remark: If a Syntax-Check would be added to this method, then it should be called from Measure to check this parameter there too.

        Parameters:
        FileName - has to be 'MEM1'-'MEM4' or 'xxx.mes', 'xxx.str', or 'xxx.cst' see manual page 5-70
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • DisplayUpdate

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Enable/Disable updating the display of the 4155.",
                   ParameterNames="Update Display",
                   ToolTips="When true the display is updated, when false, it\'s not updated.")
public void DisplayUpdate(boolean UpdateDisplay)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Sets whether or not the display of the 4155 is updated or not. Not updating the 4155's display can speed up a measuring cycle significantly (up to approximately 1-20 sec). This method returns if it is interrupted by the user before the 4155 becomes ready to receive a command.
        Parameters:
        UpdateDisplay - if true, the 4155 updates it's display
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from WaitAndSendToInstrument

      • AutoCalibration

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Enable/Disable Auto-Calibration of the 4155.",
                   ParameterNames="Auto Calibrate",
                   ToolTips="true/false turnes on/off Auto Calibration of the 4155.")
public void AutoCalibration(boolean AutoCalibration)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Enable/Disable Auto Calibration every 30 min. During a calibration, the 4155 should be disconnected from the device-under-test (see manual page 5-6), which I personally have never done because I was not aware of that.

        This method returns if it is interrupted by the user before the 4155 becomes ready to receive a command.

        Parameters:
        AutoCalibration - if true, the 4155 performs an auto calibration every 30 min.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from WaitAndSendToInstrument

      • SaveData

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Saves the given Data Variables in a Text File.",
                   ParameterNames={"Data Variables","File Extension","Don\'t save invalid data"},
                   ToolTips={"Comma separated list of Data Variables defined in the 4155.","","<html>If a measurement is interrupted, the 4155\'s buffer<br>contains invalid data. Check this box<br>to save only the valid data.</html>"},
                   DefaultValues={"Id,Vd,Ig,Vg,Is",".trans","true"})
public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>[] SaveData(java.lang.String DataVariables,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   java.lang.String FileExtension,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   boolean DontSaveInvalidData)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   javax.script.ScriptException
        Retrieves the specified Data Variables from the 4155 and saves them in the specified file in a text format. This method returns if it is interrupted by the user before the 4155 becomes ready to receive a command.

        During No-Communication-Mode, no data is saved, and the method just returns.

        Parameters:
        DataVariables - A comma-separated list of Data Variables that will be retrieved form the 4155 and saved in the file. The Name of the Data Variables must of course correspond exactly to the names specified in the 4155. Extra white spaces are ignored, therefore the Data Variables must not contain spaces (which is anyway not allowed by the 4155 as far as I know).
        FileExtension - Specifies the extension that will be added to the filename. The path and filename are obtained from the GUI. If the filename already exists, a new file with a counter is inserted between the FileName and the FileExtension.
        DontSaveInvalidData - If true, saving the data to the file stops as soon as all data variables for one measurement point contained +9.91E+307 (which marks invalid data). This can occur, for instance, if the user pressed 'Local' and then quickly 'Stop' at the 4155 after the script has executed a Measure command. A Status message is shown to the user in this case.
        Returns:
        null if an error of any kind occurred or a structure similar to a matrix that contains the saved data. This can be used in the successive script command to, for instance, chart the data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - This exception is bubbled-up from WaitAndQueryInstrument
        javax.script.ScriptException - 1) When a specified data variable is not available from the 4155 (not measured or measured and not stored (add it to the list)), or 2) the response of the 4155 could not be converted into the expected number format, or 3) the file could not be opened (IOException from FileWriter()), or 4) an error occurred after reading the 4155's response, or 5) writing to the file failed.
        See Also:
        WaitAndQueryInstrument(String)

      • ButtonSingle

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Press the \'Single\' button.",

public void ButtonSingle()
                                                                                                                              throws java.io.IOException,

        Starts a measurement by 'virtually' pressing the 'Single" button on the 4155.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - bubbles up from WaitAndSendToInstrument
        javax.script.ScriptException - when the 4155 is not measuring after pressing 'Start' (most likely due to a wrong channel setup (for instance power compliance is set too high).

      • Measure

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Loads a measurement setup, starts the measurement, and saves the data.",
                   ParameterNames={"Measurement Setup { [0,4] }","Data Variables","File Extension","Additional Command Line"},
                   DefaultValues={"0","Id, Vd, Ig, Vg, Is",".trans","\"\""},
                   ToolTips={"Choose \'0\' to skip loading, or choose \'1\'-\'4\' to load from internal memory or \'xxx.MES\', \'xxx.STR\', or \'xxx.CST\' to load from the disk drive","Comma separated list of Data Variables defined (and recorded) in the 4155.","The File Extension (with or without \'.\').","<html>This Command Line is executed before the measurement is started,<br> and the result is appended to the File Name.<br>This String needs to be enclosed inside double-quotes (\") !!<br>Use with caution.</html>"})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>[] Measure(java.lang.String MeasurementSetup,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        java.lang.String DataVariables,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        java.lang.String FileExtension,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        java.lang.String CommandLine)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        javax.script.ScriptException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        Measures a transfer characteristic of a transistor.
        First, a measurement setup is loaded (from internal memory or from disk), then the measurement is started, and after it is completed, the data is saved into a text file. If this method is interrupted because the user pressed the Stop button before the 4155 became ready to receive a command, then this method calls ButtonStop and returns.

        Note: All data variables that are to be saved are added to the List (button Disp/List on the 4155) to ensure that the 4155 saves them. If more than 8 data variables are specified, the implemented automatic mechanism fails and the user needs to choose which data variables are automatically saved (e.g. constant values) and add the remaining data variables manually. If more than 8 data variables are specified, this method shows a message to the user but continues to measure. This method performs a Syntax-Check.

        Parameters:
        MeasurementSetup - Specifies what measurement setup to loads: '0' does load nothing, '1'-'4' loads from the internal memory (MEM1-MEM4), and other string loads from disk and must contain an extension '.MES', '.STR' or '.CST'
        DataVariables - see SaveData(String, String, boolean)
        FileExtension - This String is appended to the File Name
        CommandLine - This String needs to be enclosed in double-quote (") and is sent to DispatchCommand before the measurement is started. The result of this command is converted to a String using the objects toString method and appended to the File Name.
        Returns:
        null if an error of any kind occurred or a structure similar to a matrix that contains the saved data. This can be used in the successive script command to, for instance, chart the data. The returned data is "passed on" from SaveData.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - bubbles up from Agilent4155#LoadMeasurementSetup, ButtonSingle, or WaitUntilReady.
        javax.script.ScriptException - bubbles up from SaveData or from dispatching the CommandLine or when an error occurred when writing the data variables to the List from checkErrorQueue.
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when Syntax-Check fails. The Syntax-Check includes a simple check if DataVariables is not empty, and also if the CommandLine can be interpreted (this is done by sending it to DispatchCommand which performs a full Syntax-Check on the CommandLine.

      • PlotData

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Plots the specified data variables in a XY chart<br>This command must immediately follow a Measure, SaveData, or PlotData script command.</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"X Data Variable","log X-axis","Y1 Data Variable","log Y1-axis","Y2 Data Variable","log Y2-axis","File Extension"},
                   DefaultValues={"Vg","false","Id","false","","false",".pd"},
                   ToolTips={"","If true, the ABSOLUTE values will be plotted on a log-scale.","","If true, the ABSOLUTE values will be plotted on a log-scale.","Leave this field empty to plot only one Data variable","If true, the ABSOLUTE values will be plotted on a log-scale.","If a File Extension is specified, the plot will be saved."})
public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>[] PlotData(java.lang.String XDataVariable,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    boolean logX,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    java.lang.String Y1DataVariable,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    boolean logY1,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    java.lang.String Y2DataVariable,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    boolean logY2,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    java.lang.String FileExtension)
        Displays the two Data Variables in an X-Y plot. This command must follow immediately to a Measure, SaveData, or PlotData script command because only those methods return the required data structure.

        If the method is called with invalid parameters or a invalid data is returned from the previous script command, nothing is plotted and the method does not interrupt scripting.

        Parameters:
        XDataVariable - The name of the data variable to use as the X-Axis
        logX - Plot X-Axis on a log scale (uses absolute values)
        Y1DataVariable - The name of the data variable to use as the Y1-Axis (left)
        logY1 - Plot Y1-Axis on a log scale (uses absolute values)
        Y2DataVariable - The name of the data variable to use as the Y2-Axis (right)
        logY2 - Plot Y2-Axis on a log scale (uses absolute values)
        FileExtension - If not empty, the plot will be saved to a file in the project directory with the base file name and this extension + added .png. A counter will be appended to the file name if it already exists.
        Returns:
        null if an error of any kind occurred or a structure similar to a matrix that contains the saved data. This can be used in the successive script command to, for instance, chart the data. The returned data is "passed on" from SaveData.

      • configSMU

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Configure a SMU</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"SMU# { [1,4] }","Vname","Iname","Mode","Function"},
                   DefaultValues={"1","V1","I1","V","Var1"},
                   ToolTips={"","","","Can be V, I, Vpulse, Ipulse, Common","Can be Constant, Var1, Var2, Disable"})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public void configSMU(int SMU_Number,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               java.lang.String Vname,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               java.lang.String Iname,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               java.lang.String Mode,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               java.lang.String Function)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               java.util.zip.DataFormatException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               javax.script.ScriptException
        Configures the SMUs.

        This method performs a Syntax-Check.

        Parameters:
        SMU_Number - The number of the SMU to configure
        Vname - The variable name of the voltage
        Iname - The variable name of the current
        Mode - The operation mode of this SMU
        Function - The Function of this SMU. The function 'Disable' deletes the settings of the SMU.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from SendToInstrument
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when the Syntax Check failed.
        javax.script.ScriptException - when the error queue contains an error (bubbles up from checkErrorQueue).

      • UserFunction

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Define a user function</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"Name","Unit","Definition"},
                   DefaultValues={"R","","V"},
                   ToolTips={"<html> The name can be up to 6 characters and must start with a letter.<br>If the name is \'All\' and the Definition is empty, all user functions are deleted.</html>","Can be empty","<html>The definition, e.g. ABS(Id).<br>If empty, the user function is deleted.<br>If empty and Name is \'All\', all user functions are deleted.</html>"})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=false)
public void UserFunction(java.lang.String Name,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              java.lang.String Unit,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              java.lang.String Definition)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              java.util.zip.DataFormatException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              javax.script.ScriptException
        Defines a User Function. Up to 6 user function can be defined. Note that when a user function contains SMU names (e.g. V1, I1) and these SMUs are disabled later, the user function is no longer valid and an error is throw at some point during programming the 4155, most likely after a somewhat unexpected operation.

        Parameters:
        Name - The Name of the User Function; can be 6 characters long and must start with a letter
        Unit - The unit of the newly defined function; can be empty
        Definition - Definition of the new user function; if the definition is empty, the user function is deleted
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from SendToInstrument
        javax.script.ScriptException - when the error queue contains an error (bubbles up from checkErrorQueue).
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException

      • configSweep

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Configure a Sweep measurement.</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"Sweep Variable","Double Sweep?","Spacing","Start","Stop","Step","Compliance","Hold Time [sec]","Delay Time [sec]"},
                   DefaultValues={"Var1","true","Lin","0","5","0.1","100e-6","1","0"},
                   ToolTips={"Can be Var1 or Var2","Single or Double sweeps? (only valid for Var1)","Can be Lin, L10, L25, or L50","Range depends on the setup","Range depends on the setup","Range depends on the setup","Range depends on the setup","Wait time before making 1st measurement of each Var1 sweep.","Delay time after each step before making a measurement."})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public void configSweep(java.lang.String SweepVariable,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      boolean DoubleSweep,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      java.lang.String Spacing,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      float Start,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      float Stop,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      float Step,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      float Compliance,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      float HoldTime,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      float DelayTime)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      java.util.zip.DataFormatException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      javax.script.ScriptException
        Configures the parameters for a Sweep measurement.

        This method performs a Syntax-Check. Note that the Syntax-Check does not guarantee 100% correctness. Some values, for instance the Compliance value, depend on the chosen measurement range, and this sophisticated level of correctness is not implemented in the Syntax-Check.

        After each step the error queue of the 4155 is checked.

        Parameters:
        SweepVariable - Can be Var1 or Var2
        DoubleSweep - If true a double sweep is measured
        Spacing - Choose between Lin, Log10, Log25, Log50 spacing
        Start - Start value of the sweep variable
        Stop - Stop value of the sweep variable
        Step - Value the sweep value is increased in every step
        Compliance - Set the compliance value for the sweep variable
        HoldTime - Wait time before making 1st measurement of each Var1 sweep.
        DelayTime - Delay time after each step before making a measurement.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from SendToInstrument
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when the Syntax Check failed.
        javax.script.ScriptException - when the error queue contains an error (bubbles up from checkErrorQueue).

      • DisplayAxis

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Configures which data variables to display as X, Y1, or Y2 axis.</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"Axis","Variable Name","Scale","Min","Max"},
                   DefaultValues={"X","V1","Linear","0","1"},
                   ToolTips={"Can be X, Y1, or Y2","e.g. Vg, Id, @TIME, ...","Can be Linear or Log"})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public void DisplayAxis(java.lang.String Axis,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            java.lang.String VariableName,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            java.lang.String Scale,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            float Min,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            float Max)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     throws javax.script.ScriptException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        Configures the data variables used to display data on the graph page of the 4155.

        This method performs a Syntax-Check. Any error that occurs during the real run is ignored so that scripting is not disturbed by this minor mistake.

        Parameters:
        Axis - Specifies which axis to change; can be X, Y1, or Y2
        VariableName - The name of the data variable to plot
        Scale - Sets the scale with which the data axis is drawn; can be Linear or Log
        Min - Sets the minimum value shown on the axis
        Max - Sets the maximum value shown on the axis
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - when the error queue contains an error (bubbles up from checkErrorQueue).
        java.io.IOException - bubbles up from WaitAndSendToInstrument
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when Syntax-check fails
